1111.content:
Anne Shepard did not feel well. The rather tall redhead had had a massive headache ever since she had been hit by the Prothean beacon, somehow including while she was unconscious. The dream was strange and did not make any sense, something snakelike was in it, but that was about it. But the strangest thing was that she felt different. Like she had changed drastically, on a fundamental level. But above that feeling, she was starving. So, after she was checked out of the medbay, she decided that she needed the rest, and went to go get some food before retiring to her quarters. After getting some fruit, she noticed several people she passed giving her odd stares. Attributing it to her looking sick, she continues on.

Coming to her room, she enters, and immediately collapses into her chair. But something is off. The chair is rather uncomfortable, almost like it is... too small. Now that she thinks of it, everything in the room looks smaller than it used to, much smaller. Deciding that she would have to check for herself, she goes into the bathroom and measures her own height, finding that she is 6"2, which is over four inches taller than she was previously. Now very freaked out, she paces over to her table and grabs an apple, before walking along the room, thinking about what this could mean.

In her concentration, she attempts to take a bite of the apple, not realizing that she was swallowing it whole until it was halfway down her throat. Very surprised at this, she gulps it down completely and starts gasping "What the hell was that?" she asks to herself, once the coughing fit was over. Seeing the small lump in her belly, she decides that she should try to eat another apple. Picking it up, appraising it, she finds that it is slightly bigger than the first. With a strange lack of hesitation, she puts it in her mouth, surprise becoming evident when her lips stretch over the apple, and she swallows it down without any trouble. She was confused, it felt so good, so right. What would she do with this?

121.content:
The Quarian sighed within her suit as she stared at a photo of Commander Shepard. Oh, how she desired the Commander. From day one, the Quarian had taken a liking to Shepard. His wonderful face, his slick smooth hair, his personality, everything about him Tali loved! If only she were given a chance.

Day in and day out, Tali dreamed of feeling Shepard up closer than usual. To feel his body, to touch him, to feel him slowly sink into her stoma--. Tali shook her head to throw away that thought. She had to remember, humans had different mating rituals. All species did.

Quarians had what other species of the Citadel would call, "A very very very VERY strange mating ritual". Females were known for being able to swallow their mates, of course it was non-lethal to the males...but for the other races? Not so much. Many Quarian interspecies relationships where the female was Quarian would often end bitter-sweetly. No matter how hard she tried, the female would get too carried away during sex and would eventually, swallow their mate whole, forever ending their relationship.

Tali sighed, if the Commander ever did want her, she didn't want THAT to happen to him...well, maybe.

Suddenly...

1252.content:
EDI was unsure of how to proceed. She had successfully repaired the body of Dr. Eva, the AI, at least most of it. However, there was the remaining question of just what to do with it. She could mine its information and simply leave it as is. She could simply avoid the risk of countermeasures and space it. Or... she could reactivate it, and attempt to take the body for herself. And the body would be worth the risk, in her opinion. It was an incredibly advanced body,able to mimic a regular human almost flawlessly. If she repaired the modular coating, she could pass for a human. The body itself had a wide variety of advantages, from enough storage space to house a blue box AI, to an extreme strength that was made evident during the fight with it. But possibly the most exciting thing, at least to EDI, was that the body itself was composed of modular filaments, allowing for redistribution and reshaping almost immediately. With this body, she could effectively shapeshift. And finally, inside the body, there was a fabrication machine, which could create more of any material that the body needed to function, out of the right material.

It would be a huge advantage, but what would happen if she failed? She would lose the body for sure, and, in a worst case scenario, the process could backfire. The AI currently in the body, EVA, could reactivate. She could lose control. She could die... No. The benefits outweigh the risks. EDI activated the Body.

The only problem was that she had drastically underestimated the time that it would take to get there, as, true to her luck, the Migrant Fleet was going through the same Mass Relay they were going to go through. That could take days, and the trip was only supposed to take about half of one. She didn't have much for food...

By the second day, Kasumi was absolutely starving. Having hid in a nook behind a crate, she slowly climbs on top, deciding that she could not take it anymore.
